revised_title: Anatomical Malformation of the Uterine System and Physiological Conclusions
tldr: The author describes a unique case of a woman with a malformation in her uterine system, where one side of the womb, fallopian tube, and ovarium were underdeveloped. This case challenges previous theories about the cause of procreating male and female offspring. The author also discusses the existence of separate placentas in cases of twins and the process of generation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Reproduction
